summary: This is an email chain from November 2019 among federal prosecutors (USANYS) discussing an update on the Epstein investigation. It mentions a meeting in California that did not yield significant new information, the inability to bring an enticement charge based on timing/location, a victim's uncertainty about pursuing a criminal case, and an upcoming limited proffer session with a witness.

persons.name: Ic M.IIMIr
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the forwarded email chain on November 18, 2019, coordinating a meeting time.

events.title: Meeting in California regarding Epstein case
events.description: A meeting was held in California that did not add significant information; it was determined an enticement charge could not be brought based on timing/location facts.

events.title: Upcoming limited proffer session
events.description: A witness is scheduled for a limited proffer session to discuss her background.

keyFacts: Prosecutors determined they 'almost certainly couldn't bring an enticement charge' against Epstein based on timing and location facts.
A victim was still unsure whether she wanted to pursue a criminal case; her attorneys were to be circled back with later in November 2019.
The victim did not want to discuss specific conduct at the California meeting, so no additional information was obtained.
Prosecutors were continuing to work on a 'pile of memos' and noted a witness was coming in for a limited proffer session.
The email chain shows ongoing coordination among federal prosecutors in the Epstein investigation in late 2019.
